unnormalised: It was a typical Sunday morning in Mumbai. My mother, like clockwork, handed me the shopping list and a crumpled ₹500 note. "Go to the bazaar and get the veggies, beta. And check the prices properly this time!"
normalised: It was a typical Sunday morning in Mumbai. My mother, like clockwork, handed me the shopping list and a crumpled rupee five hundred note. "Go to the bazaar and get the veggies, beta. And check the prices properly this time!"

unnormalised: The list was a mix of everyday needs and a few seasonal specials: 1 kg potatoes, 500 gm onions, 250 gm green chilies, 1 bunch of coriander, and 2 coconuts. The challenge wasn't just the quantity but the negotiation. The vendors in Dadar market were notorious for quoting high prices to start with.
normalised: The list was a mix of everyday needs and a few seasonal specials: one kilogram potatoes, five hundred gram onions, two hundred and fifty gram green chilies, one bunch of coriander, and two coconuts. The challenge wasn't just the quantity but the negotiation. The vendors in Dadar market were notorious for quoting high prices to start with.

unnormalised: First stop, the potato stall. "Bhaiya, what's the rate for potatoes?" I asked. "₹30 per kg," he replied, a little too quickly. I knew the trick – pretend to walk away. "Thela wale bhaiya near the station are selling at ₹25 per kg," I countered, feigning disinterest. He sighed dramatically. "Okay, okay, ₹28 for you, since you're a regular." I bought 1 kg.
normalised: First stop, the potato stall. "Bhaiya, what's the rate for potatoes?" I asked. "Rupee thirty per kilogram," he replied, a little too quickly. I knew the trick – pretend to walk away. "Thela wale bhaiya near the station are selling at rupee twenty five per kilogram," I countered, feigning disinterest. He sighed dramatically. "Okay, okay, rupee twenty eight for you, since you're a regular." I bought one kilogram.

unnormalised: Next, the onions. The vendor quoted ₹40 per kg. I asked for 500 gm, which he weighed generously, almost 600 gms. "Keep the extra," I said, already thinking of the delicious onion pakoras we'd have with chai later. The coriander bunch was a steal at ₹10, but the green chilies were expensive at ₹60 for 250 gm. After some haggling, I managed to get them for ₹50. The 2 coconuts, essential for Sunday's coconut rice, cost me ₹35 each. Not bad, considering. By the end, I had spent ₹248. I even had some change left for a samosa!
normalised: Next, the onions. The vendor quoted rupee forty per kilogram. I asked for five hundred gram, which he weighed generously, almost six hundred grams. "Keep the extra," I said, already thinking of the delicious onion pakoras we'd have with chai later. The two coconuts, essential for Sunday's coconut rice, cost me rupee thirty five each. Not bad, considering. By the end, I had spent rupee two hundred and forty eight.
